description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows, follow these steps:

1. Download and apply the relevant updates according to your system version from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems, use update KB5044284.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems, use update KB5044285.
   - For Windows 10 for x64-based Systems, use update KB5044286.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems, use update KB5044273.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems, use update KB5044280.

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
This patch addresses an untrusted pointer dereference vulnerability allowing elevation of privilege. Ensure you are running a supported version of Windows before applying the updates. 

You can find these updates at the following links:
- [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
- [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
- [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)
- [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
- [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a compatible version of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
